courses.subject: CLCC
courses.title: Survival Cantonese for International Students
courses.description: A non-credit-bearing basic Cantonese course offering to CUHK international students, including exchange students, full-time undergraduate and postgraduate students, who use Chinese as a second/foreign language and are looking for survival skills in Cantonese. The course is structured to help students communicate orally with people in Cantonese in different scenarios, with student-centred, proficiency-orientated activities based on useful daily expressions and basic vocabulary items. This course focuses on students' listening and speaking skills. Real-life settings are introduced, such as shopping, introduction of oneself, asking for directions, etc.
courses.learning_outcomes:
Students are expected to:
(PO1: for level 1) ask and respond to simple questions, convey minimal meaning, and satisfy a number of immediate needs based on everyday topics
(S&L2) apply selected vocabulary items and grammatical patterns at the sentence level in daily conversations with appropriate usage

學生於完成本科時預期能：
（學習成果：第一級）使用簡短問答應付日常生活中的基本需求
(S&L2) 將所學句式和詞彙組成簡短對話並恰當地運用於日常生活之中
courses.course_syllabus:
Learning topics include:
- Introduction to Cantonese sounds and tones and basic Cantonese particles. Common loan words in Cantonese
- Basic greeting expressions and classroom expressions
- Common dishes in Hong Kong
- Simple useful expressions for telephone conversation, taxis and minibuses
- Places of interests in Hong Kong
- Sports and pastime
- Clothes and basic necessity
- Names of major buildings in CUHK and campus facilities (dormitories, supermarket, clinic and canteen, etc.)

內容包括：
- 粵語語音及拼寫法、常見外來語
- 問候、課室用語
- 常見香港菜餚
- 電話對話、乘搭的士及小巴的通用語
- 香港名勝
- 運動及娛樂
- 衣履及日常用品
- 中大主要大樓名稱及校園設施（宿舍、超市、保健處、飯堂等等）
courses.feedback_evaluation: Course evaluation will be conducted at the end.
courses.required_readings: Textbook chapters and supplementary materials provided by the course teacher.

courses.subject: CLCC
courses.title: Cantonese Taster Course for CUHK International Students
courses.description:
[This course is offered via asynchronous online mode. Students should register the course via KEEP, a CUHK eLearning platform where the course materials are uploaded.]

This course is an asynchronous online course offering to CUHK international students. This taster course focuses on helping students engage in basic daily social interaction using Cantonese.
courses.enrollment_requirement:
Not for stu who have taken any CLCC courses (except CLCC1000,1102,1103) or any CLCP courses for local stu
For non-local stu who do not know Cantonese
From 2023-24, stu can only earn up to 2 units of the 1-unit online lang courses
courses.learning_outcomes:
Students are expected to:
(PO1: for level 1) ask and respond to simple questions, convey minimal meaning, and satisfy a number of immediate needs based on everyday topics
(S&L1) understand and reply to utterances containing selected vocabulary items and grammar points at the sentence level in daily conversations

學生於完成本科時預期能：
（學習成果：第一級）使用簡短問答應付日常生活中的基本需求
(S&L1) 掌握基本詞彙，能聽懂日常生活中的簡短對話並作出回應
courses.course_syllabus:
1. Greeting Expressions and Self-Introduction
2. Shopping and Dining
3. Transportation
4. Major festivals and holidays
courses.feedback_evaluation:
1. Course and Teaching Evaluation Survey
2. Internal Course Review
courses.required_readings: Supplementary materials provided by the course teacher.
courses.recommended_readings: Supplementary materials provided by the course teacher.

courses.subject: CLCC
courses.title: Survival Cantonese for Native Putonghua Speakers
courses.description: A non-credit-bearing basic Cantonese course designed for Mandarin-speaking undergraduate and postgraduate students who are looking for survival skills in Cantonese. The course is structured to help students communicate orally with people in Cantonese in different scenarios, with student-centred, proficiency-orientated activities based on useful daily expressions and basic vocabulary items. This course focuses on students' listening and speaking skills.
courses.enrollment_requirement:
1. Not for students who have taken CLCC1703,2703&3703 or CCAN2013,1703,2703&3703
2. For Putonghua-speaking non-local students who are absolute beginners in Cantonese
courses.learning_outcomes:
Students are expected to:
(PO1: for level 1) ask and respond to simple questions, convey minimal meaning, and satisfy a number of immediate needs based on everyday topics
(S&L2) apply selected vocabulary items and grammatical patterns at the sentence level in daily conversations with appropriate usage

學生於完成本科時預期能：
（學習成果：第一級）使用簡短問答應付日常生活中的基本需求
(S&L2) 將所學句式和詞彙組成簡短對話並恰當地運用於日常生活之中
courses.course_syllabus:
Learning topics include:
- Introduction to Cantonese sounds and tones and basic Cantonese particles. Comparison between Putonghua and Cantonese
- Greeting expressions and classroom expressions
- Names of major cities and countries
- Enquiries
- Clothes and basic necessity
- Telephone conversation
- Transportation and useful expressions for taxis and minibuses
- Places of interests in Hong Kong
- Common dishes in Hong Kong
- Adjectives to describe people and posts
- CUHK specific: Faculties, departments and colleges names; common job titles; landmarks and major buildings in CUHK; campus facilities (dormitories, supermarket, clinic and canteen, etc.)

內容包括：
- 粵語語音及拼寫法、普廣對比
- 話題: 問候、課室用語
- 大城市及國家的名稱
- 查詢
- 衣履及日常用品
- 電話對話
- 交通、乘搭的士及小巴的通用語
- 香港名勝
- 常見香港菜餚
- 形容人物及工作職位的稱謂
- 中大學院/學系/書院名稱、常用職級、中大主要景點及大樓名稱、校園設施（宿舍、超市、保健處、飯堂等等）
courses.feedback_evaluation: Course evaluation will be conducted at the end.
courses.required_readings: Textbook chapters and supplementary materials provided by the course teacher.

courses.subject: CLCC
courses.title: Introduction to Chinese Characters
courses.description: An elementary course to introduce basic Chinese characters with real life examples in Hong Kong. This course will introduce the formation of Chinese characters and stroke orders. It will also discuss the use of traditional and simplified Chinese characters to arouse students’ interest and awareness of the usage of Chinese characters in different cities in the Greater Bay Area.
courses.course_syllabus:
1. History and evolution of Chinese characters
2. Formation of Chinese characters I
3. Formation of Chinese characters II
4. Radicals and stroke orders
5. Traditional and simplified Chinese characters
6. The use of traditional and simplified characters in Greater Bay Area
7. Technology and Chinese characters (inputs systems, online resources, etc.)
courses.feedback_evaluation:
1. Course and Teaching Evaluation Survey
2. Internal Course Review

courses.subject: CLCC
courses.title: Introduction to Chinese Scripts
courses.description: An elementary course to introduce basic Chinese characters with real life examples. Introduction will also be given to the formation of Chinese characters, stroke order, and the interesting stories behind.
courses.learning_outcomes:
Students are expected to:
(PO1: for level 1) ask and respond to simple questions, convey minimal meaning, and satisfy a number of immediate needs based on everyday topics
(R1) understand basic knowledge of Chinese characters (e.g. radicals, stroke order, etc.) and read commonly used basic vocabulary and phrases

學生於完成本科時預期能：
（學習成果：第一級）使用簡短問答應付日常生活中的基本需求
(R1) 掌握漢字的基本知識（例如，部首、筆順等），能閱讀常用基礎詞彙及短語
courses.course_syllabus:
This course provides basic knowledge of Chinese scripts, including
1. Historical facts
2. Stroke order
3. Radicals
4. Character formation
courses.feedback_evaluation:
1. Course and Teaching Evaluation Survey
2. Internal Course Review

courses.subject: CLCC
courses.title: Application of Vocabulary and Grammar I
courses.description: An elementary course designed to familiarise students with the use of romanization, basic vocabulary and sentence structure. Vocabulary introduced is based on everyday conversations and daily usage. The focus will be on appropriateness in language use.
courses.learning_outcomes:
Students are expected to:
(PO1: for level 1) ask and respond to simple questions, convey minimal meaning, and satisfy a number of immediate needs based on everyday topics
(S&L1) understand and reply to utterances containing selected vocabulary items and grammar points at the sentence level in daily conversations

學生於完成本科時預期能：
（學習成果：第一級）使用簡短問答應付日常生活中的基本需求
(S&L1) 掌握基本詞彙，能聽懂日常生活中的簡短對話並作出回應
courses.course_syllabus:
This course introduces Cantonese sounds and tones as well as vocabulary items and sentence patterns in relation to the topics below:
1. Greetings
2. At school
3. What time is it?
4. What is today’s date?
5. A shopping day

courses.title: Listening Comprehension and Communication Skills I
courses.description: An elementary course focuses on building up students’ listening ability in real life context. Everyday settings are introduced such as shopping, introducing family members, asking directions etc.

courses.subject: CLCC
courses.title: Sounds of Cantonese
courses.description: This course introduces the phonetic system of Cantonese to CUHK international students. Supported by audiovisual aids, students will understand the sound of the vowels and consonants, the pronunciation rules, and the intonations in casual conversations and in reading literature. The articulation of some Cantonese sounds that needs attention for second language learners will also be examined. Through interactive classroom learning activities, students' accuracy of Cantonese pronunciation will be enhanced.
courses.course_syllabus:
1. Structure of a Cantonese syllable: initial and final
2. Consonants: word initials and word final consonants
3. Stops, fricatives, affricates, nasals and laterals
4. Aspiration
5. Vowels: single vowels and vowel glides
6. Tones
7. Tones in phrases
8. Speaking in context
courses.feedback_evaluation:
1. Course and Teaching Evaluation Survey
2. Internal Course Review

courses.subject: CLCC
courses.title: Basic Presentation Skills and Daily Situations
courses.description: An elementary course which helps students build up abilities in presenting basic ideas in real-life communication settings. Tasks like picture description, speaking exercises and simple presentations will be adopted to train students in presentations in various everyday settings.
courses.learning_outcomes:
Students are expected to:
(PO1: for level 1) ask and respond to simple questions, convey minimal meaning, and satisfy a number of immediate needs based on everyday topics
(S&L5) present ideas at the sentence level in daily communication settings

學生於完成本科時預期能：
（學習成果：第一級）使用簡短問答應付日常生活中的基本需求
(S&L5) 以完整正確的語句於日常生活的不同語境中表達意見
courses.course_syllabus: This is an elementary course, which helps students build up abilities in presenting basic ideas in real-life communication settings. Tasks like picture description, speaking exercises and simple presentations will be adopted to train students in presentations in various everyday settings.

2. Internal Course Review

courses.subject: CLCC
courses.title: Elementary Cantonese for Chinese Speakers

meetings.location: William M W Mong Eng Bldg 713
William M W Mong Eng Bldg 713
William M W Mong Eng Bldg 713

courses.description: This is a foundation course on Cantonese which introduces Cantonese romanization systems to students. Course contents include basic daily conversations, vowels and tone exercises and pronunciation practice. This course will enable learners to engage in simple real-life conversations by using Cantonese.
courses.enrollment_requirement: 1. Not for students who have taken CCAN2013, CLCC2703, CCAN1703 or CCAN2703; 2. For Putonghua-speaking non-local students who are absolute beginners in Cantonese.
courses.learning_outcomes:
Students are expected to:
(PO2: for levels 2-3) participate in simple conversations on predictable topics, obtain information by asking and answering questions, combine learned materials to convey meaning, and satisfy personal needs and social demands
(S&L4) comprehend discourse and conversations and give appropriate responses in short connected utterances

學生於完成本科時預期能：
（學習成果：第二級和第三級）於預設話題中參與簡單的會話或討論，具備在對話中獲得信息的能力，並能結合所學內容與人溝通、滿足基本的交際需要
(S&L4) 具備聆聽、理解對話及語段並作出恰當回應的能力
courses.course_syllabus:
粵語語音(聲母、韻母、聲調、廣東話普通話語音比較)
1. 介紹自己
2. 談校園活動
3. 去飯堂食晏
4. 出街買嘢
5. 談娛樂消遣
6. 說香港天氣
7. 介紹我嘅屋企
8. 去睇醫生
9. 介紹香港
10. 論香港民生
courses.feedback_evaluation:
1. Course and Teaching Evaluation Survey
2. Internal Course Review

courses.subject: CLCC
courses.title: Medical Cantonese I
courses.description: An elementary Cantonese course designed to familiarise medical students and medical professionals with basic medical vocabulary and sentence structure through language tasks/activities and contextualised exercises. Daily real-life clinical settings are introduced.
courses.enrollment_requirement:
1.For students who have taken CLCC1113
2.For students who have not completed any of the above courses listed in #1, they are invited to take a Cantonese placement test offered by CLA
courses.learning_outcomes:
Students are expected to:
PO1: (for level 1) ask and respond to simple questions, convey minimal meaning, and satisfy a number of immediate needs based on everyday topics.
(S&L2) apply selected vocabulary items and grammatical patterns at the sentence level in daily conversations with appropriate usage
(S&L3) communicate fluently with selected vocabulary items and grammatical patterns at the sentence level in daily settings

學生於完成本科時預期能：
（學習成果：第一級）使用簡短問答應付日常生活中的基本需求
(S&L2) 將所學句式和詞彙組成簡短對話並恰當地運用於日常生活之中
(S&L3) 運用所學詞彙和句式在現實生活的不同語境中與人進行簡單的問答
courses.course_syllabus:
Lesson 1: Medical appointment
Introduction to Cantonese sounds, greetings, making medical appointments, seeking personal information, talking about time and names of public hospitals in Hong Kong.

Lesson 2: Health examination
Introduction to professional terminology in health check-ups and body parts, asking about medical history, and kinship terms.

Lesson 3: Outpatient orientation
Medical terminology and expressions in general outpatient care and diagnosis, names of medical departments in a hospital.

Lesson 4: Diet and nutrition
Introduction to Cantonese vocabulary for food items, nutrition terms, and dining habits.

Lesson 5: Medical emergencies
Introduction to emergency medical terminology and internal organs.

Lesson 6: Surgery and procedures
Introduction to general medical terminology in surgery, surgical procedures, and post-operative recovery process.

Lesson 7: Psychiatry terms
Introduction to the terminology for describing psychiatric disorders.

Lesson 8: Gastroenterology terms
Introduction to medical terms related to gastrointestinal diseases.
courses.feedback_evaluation:
1. Course and Teaching Evaluation Survey
2. Internal Course Review
courses.required_readings: Materials prepared by Yale-China Chinese Language Academy
courses.recommended_readings: Materials prepared by Yale-China Chinese Language Academy

(R1) understand basic knowledge of Chinese characters (e.g. radicals, stroke order, etc.) and read commonly used basic vocabulary and phrases

學生於完成本科時預期能：
（學習成果：第一級）使用簡短問答應付日常生活中的基本需求
(S&L1) 掌握基本詞彙，能聽懂日常生活中的簡短對話並作出回應
(R1) 掌握漢字的基本知識（例如，部首、筆順等），能閱讀常用基礎詞彙及短語
courses.course_syllabus:
This course provides training on reading Chinese characters in context. Practical applications of Chinese characters in real life contexts are introduced and practiced. This course focuses on reading skills training on phrase and sentence level.

2. Chinese readings on sentence level

(S&L4) 具備聆聽、理解日常對話中的語句及作出恰當回應的能力
courses.course_syllabus:
This is an intermediate course focused on building up students’ listening ability. Real-life settings are introduced.
1. Going to the airport
2. Attending a wedding party
3. Going to see movies
4. Discussing travel plans
5. Talking about hobbies, etc.
courses.feedback_evaluation:
1. Course and Teaching Evaluation Survey
2. Internal Course Review

courses.subject: CLCC
courses.title: Cantonese through Songs
courses.description: This is an integrated theme-based course designed for students who want to improve their Cantonese listening and speaking skills through the appreciation of Cantonese songs. This course focuses on the analysis of linguistic and cultural aspects of Cantonese songs. Coursework will include listening and reading exercises, class discussions of selected Cantonese songs with their peers, and a series of short talks prepared by students on an aspect of Cantonese songs. Emphasis will be also placed on the training of accurate Cantonese pronunciation through the reading of lyrics. The course will increase students’ cultural awareness, vocabulary and communicative competence in Cantonese.
courses.enrollment_requirement:
1. For students who have taken CLCC1703,CCAN1703,2013 or above. 
2. For students who have not completed any of the above courses listed in #1, they are invited to take a Cantonese placement test offered by CLA
courses.course_syllabus:
1. Some facts about Cantonese songs
2. Genres of Cantonese songs
3. Vocabulary related to songs
4. Selected Cantonese songs and lyrics
5. The relationship between Cantonese songs and culture
courses.feedback_evaluation:
1. Course and Teaching Evaluation Survey
2. Internal Course Review

courses.subject: CLCC
courses.title: Intermediate Cantonese for Chinese Speakers

meetings.location: William M W Mong Eng Bldg 405
William M W Mong Eng Bldg 405
William M W Mong Eng Bldg 405
William M W Mong Eng Bldg 405

courses.description:
An intermediate course for students who have completed CLCC1703, CCAN1703 or CCAN2013. For students who have not completed any of the above courses, they are invited to take a Cantonese placement test offered by CLA. Course contents focus on social topics. This course improves students' pronunciation and exchange of ideas in different social activities. Furthermore, the course will help students complete a number of tasks in school or working environment.

Advisory: For Mandarin-speaking students who are not beginners.
courses.enrollment_requirement:
1.For students who have taken CLCC1703,CCAN1703,2013
2.Not for students taken CLCC3703,CCAN3703 or CCAN3013
3.For students who have not completed any of the above courses listed in #1, they are invited to take a Cantonese placement test offered by CLA
courses.learning_outcomes:
Students are expected to:
(PO3: for level 4) actively participate in conversations on various topics in some formal and most informal settings, handle a wide variety of linguistic tasks with communicative strategies, and effectively deal with unanticipated complications in communication, satisfying requirements of school and work situations
(S&L3) communicate fluently in professional discourse containing selected vocabulary items and grammatical structures in real-life settings
(R3) read and understand authentic articles related to daily life, culture, or society targeted at native Chinese speakers

學生於完成本科時預期能：
（學習成果：第四級）具備參與在正式及非正式場合中交際的能力，能就不同話題發表意見，並根據不同交際場境調整談話策略，能完成學習或工作中常見的任務
(S&L3) 有效運用所學詞彙和句式在正式場合中與人進行交際溝通
(R3) 讀懂以中文母語者為目標讀者的與日常生活、文化或社會話題相關的文章
courses.course_syllabus:
粵語語音、粵語普通話語音比較
1. 改善居住環境
2. 體驗香港美食
3. 閒話潮流服飾
4. 乘搭交通工具
5. 協助處理罪案
6. 參加文娛活動
7. 了解草根民生
8. 關注環境保護
9. 探討社會問題
10. 暢談教育制度
courses.feedback_evaluation:
1. Course and Teaching Evaluation Survey
2. Internal Course Review

courses.subject: CLCC
courses.title: Medical Cantonese II
courses.description: An intermediate Cantonese course designed to familiarise medical students and medical professionals with newly acquired vocabulary and sentence structure through language tasks/activities and contextualised exercises in real-life clinical settings.
courses.enrollment_requirement:
1. For students who have taken CLCC1123, CLCC1703, CLCC1903.
2. For students who have not completed any of the above courses listed in #1, they are invited to take a Cantonese placement test offered by CLA.
courses.learning_outcomes:
Students are expected to:
(PO2: for levels 2-3) participate in simple conversations on predictable topics, obtain information by asking and answering questions, combine learned materials to convey meaning, and satisfy personal needs and social demands
(S&L2) apply selected vocabulary items and grammatical structures in short connected utterances in most real-life conversations with appropriate usage
(S&L3) communicate fluently with selected vocabulary items and grammatical structures in short connected utterances in most real-life settings

學生於完成本科時預期能：
（學習成果：第二級和第三級）於預設話題中參與簡單的會話或討論，具備在對話中獲得信息的能力，並能結合所學內容與人溝
通、滿足基本的交際需要。
(S&L2) 運用所學詞彙和句式完成簡短的成段對話並恰當地運用於日常生活之中
(S&L3) 運用所學詞彙和句式在現實生活的不同語境中與人進行有效的溝通
courses.course_syllabus:
1. General Hospital Scenario
Introduction to Cantonese sounds and basic medical terminologies.

2. Common Phrase in Medical Setting
Conversational phrases for patient assessment in general out-patient clinics.

3. Human Anatomy and History Taking
Introduction to basic medical terminologies for human anatomy and history taking.

4. Medical Procedures and Examinations
Practice vocabulary related to medical examinations and procedures.

5. Operations and Surgery
Introduction to basic medical terminologies for operations and surgery.

6. Emergency Situations and Urgent Care
Practice vocabulary and phrases for emergencies in hospitals.

7. Bad News and End-of-Life Discussions
Introduction of appropriate language use for discussing palliative care and end-of-life discussions with patients and their families.

8. Mental Health and Counseling
Practice vocabulary related to mental health, counseling, and psychological well-being.

9. Communicating with Sensitivity and Empathy
Introduction of vocabulary and phrases for reaction to bereave mentor sensitive topics/ dealing with conflict.
courses.feedback_evaluation:
1. Course and Teaching Evaluation Survey
2. Internal Course Review
courses.required_readings: Materials prepared by Yale-China Chinese Language Academy
courses.recommended_readings: Materials prepared by Yale-China Chinese Language Academy

courses.subject: CLCC
courses.title: Cantonese for Real-Life Communication (Formal Settings)
courses.description: A non-credit-bearing Cantonese course designed for Mandarin-speaking undergraduate students, postgraduate students, tutors or research assistants. The course is structured to help students learn relevant expressions and apply them in their tutorial lessons or at work. Training includes: (1) effective utilisation of basic Cantonese in communicating with local students during tutorials and (2) proper use of academic Cantonese to make simple descriptions and presentations of one's thesis to their academic advisors or colleagues. Students will acquire relevant vocabulary in professional settings. This course helps students adjust to University and work life in Hong Kong. Furthermore, the course can improve students' Cantonese speaking ability in the tutorial classes they are hosting.
courses.enrollment_requirement:
1.For student who have taken CLCC1100,1703,2703orCCAN1703,2703,2013or3013
2.Not for student taken CLCC3703,CCAN3703or4013
3.For students who have not completed any of the above courses listed in #1,they are invited to take placement test offered by CLA
courses.learning_outcomes:
Students are expected to:
(PO3: for level 4) actively participate in conversations on various topics in some formal and most informal settings, handle a wide variety of linguistic tasks with communicative strategies, and effectively deal with unanticipated complications in communication, satisfying requirements of school and work situations
(S&L2) apply selected vocabulary items and grammatical structures at the discourse level in real-life professional conversations with appropriate usage

學生於完成本科時預期能：
（學習成果：第四級）具備參與在正式及非正式場合中交際的能力，能就不同話題發表意見，並根據不同交際場境調整談話策略，能完成學習或工作中常見的任務
(S&L2) 運用所學句式和詞彙做出得體應對，滿足在正式場合中的交際需要
courses.course_syllabus:
Learning topics include:
- Topics: Introduce one’s professional field, ask questions and obtain skills to express ideas, share difficulties and solutions about living in the University, relevant vocabularies at work, presenting to the public, lead mock tutorials and academic forums
- Classroom teaching and exercises: Listening practice, language tasks, correction of pronunciation and grammar points and group discussion
- Classroom learning includes the role of Computerized Oral Proficiency Assessment (COPA) as an assessment tool developed by CLC in 2000 from which appropriate level of semi-authentic life tasks will be selected for practice by students as part of the course. Students will be equipped to participate in different social and formal interactions

內容包括：

- 話題: 介紹自己的專業、粤語的提問及表達技巧、分享在大學生活遇到的困難及解決方法、工作用語、公開場合演講、模擬導修課、模擬學術研討會

- 練習及上課形式: 聆聽練習、完成語文任務、糾正發音及語法、小組討論

- 課堂教學將在本所2000年開發並實施的電腦口語水平測試 (COPA) 題庫中，選取相應的虛擬仿真語境，訓練學生完成不同功能的會話任務，令學生具備應對不同場合、不同交際對象進行交際的能力
courses.feedback_evaluation: Course evaluation will be conducted at the end.
courses.required_readings: Textbook chapters and supplementary materials provided by the course teacher.

courses.subject: CLCC
courses.title: Reading in Context II
courses.description: An upper intermediate course to introduce the use of Chinese characters with real life examples and contextualized exercises. It will focus on recognition of Chinese characters and readings at paragraph level.
courses.learning_outcomes:
Students are expected to:
(PO2: for levels 2-3) participate in simple conversations on predictable topics, obtain information by asking and answering questions, combine learned materials to convey meaning, and satisfy personal needs and social demands
(S&L1) understand and reply to short connected utterances containing selected vocabulary items and grammatical structures in most real-life conversations
(R2) read and understand paragraphs based on daily life written with familiar vocabulary and grammar
(W1) write short paragraphs using learned Chinese characters to provide information on topics based on daily life

學生於完成本科時預期能：
（學習成果：第二級和第三級）於預設話題中參與簡單的會話或討論，具備在對話中獲得信息的能力，並能結合所學內容與人溝通、滿足基本的交際需要
(S&L1) 掌握基本詞彙和句式，能聽懂大部分日常生活中簡短的成段對話並作出回應
(R2) 讀懂由熟悉的字詞和句式組成的與日常生活相關的段落
(W1)使用學過的漢字書寫簡短的段落來提供與日常生活相關的信息
courses.course_syllabus:
This course provides training on Chinese characters reading. This course focuses on reading skills training on paragraph level.
1. Chinese readings on sentence level
2. Chinese readings on paragraph level

2. Internal Course Review

The focus will be on appropriateness in language use. Real-life settings are introduced, such as buying a computer, going to see a doctor, renting a flat, moving to a new home, etc.

5. Courtesy and custom

courses.subject: CLCC
courses.title: Advanced Cantonese for Chinese Speakers
courses.description:
An advanced course for students who have completed CLCC2703, CCAN2703 or CCAN3013. For students who have not completed any of the above courses, they are invited to take a Cantonese placement test offered by CLA.

This course equips students with various advanced communicative skills in various academic and professional settings, such as seminars, meetings, group discussions, debates, presentations, performances, impromptu speaking, etc. Students are trained to speak in connected discourse in academic and professional settings with different levels of formality.
courses.enrollment_requirement:
1. For students who have taken CLCC2703 or CCAN2703 (3013). 
2. Not for students who have taken CCAN4013.
3. For students who have not completed any of the above courses listed in #1, they are invited to take a Cantonese placement test offered by CLA.
courses.learning_outcomes:
Students are expected to:
(PO3: for level 4) actively participate in conversations on various topics in some formal and most informal settings, handle a wide variety of linguistic tasks with communicative strategies, and effectively deal with unanticipated complications in communication, satisfying requirements of school and work situations
(S&L5) present ideas at the discourse level in real-life professional settings
(R3) read and understand authentic articles related to daily life, culture, or society targeted at native Chinese speakers

學生於完成本科時預期能：
（學習成果：第四級）具備參與在正式及非正式場合中交際的能力，能就不同話題發表意見，並根據不同交際場境調整談話策略，能完成學習或工作中常見的任務
(S&L5) 將所學句式和詞彙適當地運用於不同的語境之中發表意見
(R3) 讀懂以中文母語者為目標讀者的與日常生活、文化或社會話題相關的文章
courses.course_syllabus:

2. 計劃多彩假期

7. 細說香港樓市

9. 招聘理想人才
10. 探討道德價值

(S&L3) communicate fluently with selected vocabulary items and grammatical structures in short connected utterances in most real-life settings

學生於完成本科時預期能：
（學習成果：第二級和第三級）於預設話題中參與簡單的會話或討論，具備在對話中獲得信息的能力，並能結合所學內容與人溝通、滿足基本的交際需要
(S&L3) 運用所學詞彙和句式在現實生活的不同語境中與人進行有效的溝通
courses.course_syllabus:
This course provides vocabulary and speaking practice with language scenarios in relation to the topics below:
1. Looking for a job
2. Renting a flat in Hong Kong
3. Hong Kong news media
4. Hong Kong transportation
5. Hong Kong fashion
6. Hong Kong dining
courses.feedback_evaluation:
1. Course and Teaching Evaluation Survey
2. Internal Course Review

courses.subject: CLCC
courses.title: Special Topics I
courses.description: An advanced course focused on building up students’ listening ability in advanced context and presenting students with multi-media authentic materials. Topics for discussion include social issues in Hong Kong, environmental issues, Chinese custom and religion etc.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Pre-requisite: CLCC3313(CCAN3313), CLCC3323(CCAN3323), CLCC3333(CCAN3333) or CLCC3343(CCAN3343)
courses.learning_outcomes:
Students are expected to:
(PO2: for levels 2-3) participate in simple conversations on predictable topics, obtain information by asking and answering questions, combine learned materials to convey meaning, and satisfy personal needs and social demands
(S&L1) understand and reply to short connected utterances containing selected vocabulary items and grammatical structures in most real-life conversations
(S&L2) apply selected vocabulary items and grammatical structures in short connected utterances in most real-life conversations with appropriate usage
(S&L3) communicate fluently with selected vocabulary items and grammatical structures in short connected utterances in most real-life settings

學生於完成本科時預期能：
（學習成果：第二級和第三級）於預設話題中參與簡單的會話或討論，具備在對話中獲得信息的能力，並能結合所學內容與人溝通、滿足基本的交際需要
(S&L1) 掌握基本詞彙和句式，能聽懂大部分日常生活中簡短的成段對話並作出回應
(S&L2) 運用所學詞彙和句式完成簡短的成段對話並恰當地運用於日常生活之中
(S&L3) 運用所學詞彙和句式在現實生活的不同語境中與人進行有效的溝通
courses.course_syllabus: This course provides training for specific academic or career needs.
courses.feedback_evaluation:
1. Course and Teaching Evaluation Survey
2. Internal Course Review

courses.subject: CLCC
courses.title: Advanced Reading and Speaking
courses.description: An advanced course to introduce the use of Chinese characters with authentic materials and contextualized exercises in professional settings. Readings will be based on materials such as prose, argumentative essays, descriptive essays, drama scripts, etc.
courses.learning_outcomes:
Students are expected to:
(PO3: for level 4) actively participate in conversations on various topics in some formal and most informal settings, handle a wide variety of linguistic tasks with communicative strategies, and effectively deal with unanticipated complications in communication, satisfying requirements of school and work situations
(S&L1) understand and reply to professional discourse containing selected vocabulary items and grammatical structures in real-life settings
(R4) read and understand professional articles on specific topics

學生於完成本科時預期能：
（學習成果：第四級）具備參與在正式及非正式場合中交際的能力，能就不同話題發表意見，並根據不同交際場境調整談話策略，能完成學習或工作中常見的任務
(S&L1) 具有一定的詞彙量，能聽懂正式場合中一般的交際對話
(R4) 讀懂與特定話題相關的專業性文章
courses.course_syllabus:
This courses focuses on reading and speaking skills training. Authentic or semi-authentic Chinese texts are used.
1. Modern literature
2. Modern writings
courses.feedback_evaluation:
1. Course and Teaching Evaluation Survey
2. Internal Course Review

courses.subject: CLCC
courses.title: Discussion Topics on Hong Kong Issues
courses.description: An advanced course designed to build up the students’ confidence in using a variety of vocabulary in formal settings through specific topics and contextualized exercises. Topics include various local news and issues related to our society, such as education system, economy and immigration.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Pre-requisite: CLCC3313(CCAN3313), CLCC3323(CCAN3323), CLCC3333(CCAN3333) or CLCC3343(CCAN3343)
courses.learning_outcomes:
Students are expected to:
(PO3: for level 4) actively participate in conversations on various topics in some formal and most informal settings, handle a wide variety of linguistic tasks with communicative strategies, and effectively deal with unanticipated complications in communication, satisfying requirements of school and work situations
(S&L5) present ideas at the discourse level in real-life professional settings

學生於完成本科時預期能：

(S&L5) 將所學句式和詞彙適當地運用於不同的語境之中發表意見
courses.course_syllabus:
This course equips students with various advanced communicative skills in various academic and professional settings, such as meetings, group discussions, presentations, and impromptu speaking. Students are trained to speak in connected discourse in academic and professional settings with different levels of formality.

This course provides vocabulary and speaking practice with language scenarios in relation to the topics below:
1. Family life
2. Personal pursuits
3. Hong Kong education system
4. Understanding the SAR
5. New immigrants in Hong Kong
courses.feedback_evaluation:
1. Course and Teaching Evaluation Survey
2. Internal Course Review

Topics for discussion include various China news and issues related to Chinese society, such as the education system, the economy and immigration.

courses.subject: CLCC
courses.title: Newspaper Reading
courses.description: An advanced course designed to improve students' language ability through the reading and discussion of selections from newspapers in standard written Chinese. Topics include international relations, political news, crime, economic news, accidents, etc.
courses.learning_outcomes:
Students are expected to:
(PO3: for level 4) actively participate in conversations on various topics in some formal and most informal settings, handle a wide variety of linguistic tasks with communicative strategies, and effectively deal with unanticipated complications in communication, satisfying requirements of school and work situations
(S&L3) communicate fluently in professional discourse containing selected vocabulary items and grammatical structures in real-life settings
(S&L4) comprehend professional discourse and give appropriate responses at the discourse level
(S&L5) present ideas at the discourse level in real-life professional settings
(R4) read and understand professional articles on specific topics

5. China issues
6. International news

courses.subject: CLCC
courses.title: Special Topics II
courses.description: Courses designed for different kinds of working professionals, such as businesspersons, bankers, financial consultants, education specialists, religious and social workers, etc. Sector specific trainings are designed to cater for advanced students’ needs. e.g. the Cantonese for religious workers course provides training on Bible reading, Sunday liturgy and Mass liturgy.

(PO3: for level 4) actively participate in conversations on various topics in some formal and most informal settings, handle a wide variety of linguistic tasks with communicative strategies, and effectively deal with unanticipated complications in communication, satisfying requirements of school and work situations

courses.subject: CLCC
courses.title: Pragmatic Internship in China (PRINCH, Advanced Level)
courses.description: PRINCH is a task-based course designed to provide advanced level students with the opportunity to use language in real life for real communication purposes. It allows students to practice what they have learned in class through a variety of activities in the target culture, focusing on topics related to social, political and economic issue. Class format consists of three parts: 1) Pre-trip activities with teachers; 2) Theme-based trip in small groups led by teachers or teaching assistants; and 3) Post-trip tasks with teachers, such as Q&A, discussion and presentation.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Pre-requisite: CLCC3313(CCAN3313), CLCC3323(CCAN3323), CLCC3333(CCAN3333) or CLCC3343(CCAN3343)
courses.learning_outcomes:
Students are expected to:
(PO3: for level 4) actively participate in conversations on various topics in some formal and most informal settings, handle a wide variety of linguistic tasks with communicative strategies, and effectively deal with unanticipated complications in communication, satisfying requirements of school and work situations
(S&L5) present ideas at the discourse level in real-life professional settings
(W2) write essays using Chinese characters to express opinions on selected professional topics

學生於完成本科時預期能：
（學習成果：第四級）具備參與在正式及非正式場合中交際的能力，能就不同話題發表意見，並根據不同交際場境調整談話策略，能完成學習或工作中常見的任務
(S&L5) 將所學句式和詞彙適當地運用於不同的語境之中發表意見
(W2) 使用漢字書寫文章，就特定的專業話題表達意見
courses.course_syllabus:
This is a task-based course designed to provide advanced level students with the opportunity to use language in real life for real communication purposes. It allows students to practise what they have learned in class through a variety of activities in the target culture, topics include,
1. Social issues
2. Political and economic issues
3. Education issues

Class format consists of three parts,
(1) Classroom activities with teachers,
(2) Theme-based trip in small groups led by teachers or teaching assistants, and
(3) Post-trip tasks with teachers, such as Q&A, discussion and presentation.
courses.feedback_evaluation:
1. Course and Teaching Evaluation Survey
2. Internal Course Review
